body: This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/toxic/290)

comment_data.body: Codacy has false-positives about null-derefs after this line since it doesn't know about `pthread_exit`. You might be able to fix that by marking `kill_lookup_thread` w/ `_Noreturn`.
ah yeah codacy lets you ignore individual issues.

I meant that if you update the declaration of `kill_lookup_thread` with [`_Noreturn`](https://en.cppreference.com/w/c/language/_Noreturn), you won't have to ignore the issues in Codacy, and all reasonable tooling will know that any code after a `kill_lookup_thread`-call is unreachable.

Actually, I don't think that works for this particular thread because it does still return at on_exit.
edit: because I'm missing a `pthread_exit()`
